qas.question: Who warned of possible seismic activity in the area beforehand?
What did the United States Geological Survey show as the amount of displacement?
How long was the fault where the quake occurred?
Where on the fault is the possibility of future earthquakes increased?
What did Tom Parsons consider as the risk factor for strong future quakes?

context: In a United States Geological Survey (USGS) study, preliminary rupture models of the earthquake indicated displacement of <a0_0>up to <a2_0>9 meters<a2_0/><a0_0/> along a fault approximately <a3_0>240 km long<a3_0/> by <a4_0>20 km deep<a4_0/>. The earthquake generated deformations of the surface greater than 3 meters and increased the stress (and probability of occurrence of future events) at the <a5_0>northeastern and southwestern ends<a5_0/> of the fault. On May 20, USGS seismologist <a1_0>Tom Parsons<a1_0/> warned that there is "<a6_0>high risk<a6_0/>" of a major M>7 aftershock over the next weeks or months.
